source.title: The human brain is intrinsically organized into dynamic, anticorrelated functional networks

confidence_rationale: Provides foundational network-level support that action/task regimes and DMN-like regimes are dynamically opposed under many conditions.

mapping.source_claim_statement: Task-positive and default-mode systems display robust anticorrelation in intrinsic functional organization.
mapping.ree_translation: Supports MECH-025 assumption that action mode often suppresses reflective DMN-like processing to prioritize enaction.
mapping.mapping_caveat: Anticorrelation is not universal across all tasks and preprocessing choices.
mapping.source_context: Resting-state network analysis with implications for task-engaged network competition.

confidence_components.notes: Foundational support but not sufficient alone for strict suppression claims.
